definition: thoroughfare/to go straight ahead/to rush/to clash
(of water) to dash against/to mix with water/to infuse/to rinse/to flush/to develop (a film)/to rise in the air/to clash/to collide with

sentences.english: I practice it in the shower when nobody's listening.
sentences.chinese: 我在冲澡的时候练习，周围没有人听。

sentences.english: The water was cut off when I was taking a shower last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨天晚上冲澡冲到一半的时候，水突然就停了。

sentences.english: It’s a healthier way to clean your body than soaking in the water you wash in.
sentences.chinese: 冲澡比浸泡在水里更有利健康。

sentences.english: Today, I slipped as I was about to take a shower, knocking myself out cold.
sentences.chinese: 今天我准备冲澡时滑倒了，晕了过去。

sentences.english: You should avoid swallowing pool water and shower before and after you swim.
sentences.chinese: 您应该避免喝下泳池内的水，游泳前后也都要冲澡。

sentences.english: A washroom is where people can use the toilet, wash their hands, and take a shower.
sentences.chinese: 人们可以在洗手间方便，洗手以及冲澡。

sentences.english: Can you shower in a restaurant?
I shower at the swimming pool on weekdays.
sentences.chinese: 平日我到一家游泳池冲澡。

sentences.english: I fell asleep in the shower.
sentences.chinese: 我早上冲澡的时候睡着了。

definition: to bathe/to immerse oneself in a warm bath
to wash the face and rinse the mouth
taking a bath together as a couple
